inn1.comm: full and it swings away a little from Cook through to the keeper as the batsman shoulders arms
length ball close enough to Cook's off stump for him to push off the back foot, gets it to cover
fullish ball on the stumps, Cook half-forward pushing to square leg
fuller again, just outside off, Cook shoulders arms
length ball in the slot for Cook to cut and he hammers it past backward point, very well timed
on middle and off this time, clipped to square leg
length ball just outside off stump, Bell shoulders arms
tighter line to off stump, Bell stays in the crease and dabs it into the covers, it just shape away a little
a little fuller, Bell forward on off stump and plays into the covers
shorter in length, Bell goes back and pushes into the covers
similar line, a touch fuller, played from just outside off stump into the covers again
fuller and a little wider, Bell forward to drive but gets it off the outer half of the bat to point
leg side delivery and Cook clips off the hip down to long leg
length ball strikes Bell's pad above the knee roll as he misses with a flick into the leg side
short and wide, cut hard but a fine diving save from Dilshan at backward point, great save but Bell missed out there
goes for the same stroke, the line is a little tighter to off stump, comes off a bit of an under-edge and runs wide of slip, but no single available
full down the leg side, clips the bat past Sangakkara
length just outside off, Bell goes back and late cuts to third man
this is a rather majestic stroke, just back of a length outside off and Bell back foot drives with good timing but it was in the air but in the gap wide of cover
off stump ball, Bell looks to flick to leg and finds midwicket
short and pulled hard from outside off, beats the dive of midwicket and four more, pretty well timed again, kept it down well too
back foot punch on the bounce to backward point from just outside off stump
slower ball yorker on leg stump, Bell watches it carefully and tucks it down to long leg
very full and just outside off, Cook pushes at it and gets beaten, well bowled, Cook beaten for pace it seemed
tails in a little off a good length, Bell stays back and chops down to third man
off stump line, Cook stays in the crease and dabs it towards cover point
leg stump now and it comes off the thigh pad wide of the keeper for a leg bye
plays forward to a good length ball just outside off, it runs off the inside edge into the pad, a little movement available
tighter line, tucked to midwicket standing tall
fuller length outside off, Bell a long way forward to drive, gets it off the inner half of the bat back up the wicket
off stump on a good length, played forward into the covers

length ball, it swings into the pads of Cook, a big appeal for lbw, is this too high? Billy Bowden says it did and Sri Lanka do not review, right call I think, Hawk Eye has it comfortably missing the bails, it runs off the pad past slip for four
similar delivery, Cook unsure on the crease and ends up getting an edge into the front pad, good line to Cook, especially if it's coming back in a little
much fuller on the stumps, played forward and pushed out to cover point
great yorker and Cook desperately jams down on it and just gets a bat down on it and runs it out into the covers, excellent delivery
full, swinging ball towards off stump, Cook forward and pushes it towards mid-off
back of a length ball outside off, Bell forces it into the covers but finds the fielder, missed out again with a wider ball
full on off stump, firmly pushed back to the bowler
gets this back foot push into the gap for a single but Perera slides and saves at least a second
middle and leg line, clipped to square leg from the crease
well bowled, full of length, sliding across Cook who pushes at it and gets beaten
but can't follow it up and lets Cook whip him through midwicket from a fuller ball on middle and leg, it's just pulled up before the rope
off stump ball, pushed forward towards mid-off
very full on off stump, Cook pokes at it and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
oh fine delivery, Bell drives on the front foot on off stump and gets beaten by one that nibbled away, lovely
a touch shorter in length and blocked back up the wicket
full but well wide of off stump, ignored, just inside the guide lines so Bowden allows the delivery to stand
forward and driven from off stump, runs off a thick inside edge to square leg
forward driving to mid-off from a full of length ball just outside off stump
full on the stumps, driven powerfully back past the bowler but the stumps save four
length ball on the stumps, tucked wide of mid-on and they get a quick single
back of a length just outside off stump, pushed firmly to cover
forward just outside off stump, dropped into the covers
full ball on the stumps, Bell tries to swing it down the ground and nearly finds mid-on, the diving fielder can't get there and it squirms away from him for a couple
full and length but well wide of off stump and ignored
tighter line, back of a length, tucked to square leg
full and wide of off stump, Cook goes forward to drive and doesn't time it, gets a toe-end perhaps down to third man, looked a bit ungainly
length ball, angled in to off stump, tucked to midwicket
full and well wide of off stump, Bell gets down on one knee and drives over the covers for four, got it a little low on the bat but timed it pretty well and into the gap
much tighter line and played towards mid-on
poor ball, short on the stumps and Cook lifts it over square leg, totally the wrong length
full just outside off, Cook drives to Malinga's left at mid-on, he's a bit deep so they might have got a single but declined the opportunity
driven from full and wide of off stump through the covers, a sweeper has gone out but they'll get two as he runs to his left
off stump line, pushed wide of mid-on from a good length and they get a single
length on off stump, dabbed down towards point
short and pulled with a roll of the wrists wide of long leg so they get another couple
short and cut hard to the cover point sweeper, a very poor return and Sangakkara had to scramble hard to save an overthrow
back of a length around off stump, dabbed into the covers

full ball on the stumps and chipped straight to midwicket. A very poor stroke, had the whole of the on side to play into and finds the man, Bell should be very disappointed, it was a poor delivery really, drifting into the pads on a full length to be whipped away but Bell has picked out the fielder
another poor ball but this time he concedes a wide
length just outside off and dab down to third man, 50 comes up
length ball outside off, pushed firmly through the covers, a sweeper is in place
a decent short ball, well-directed and Trott sways inside the line
full just outside off, pushed up on the off side
a touch wider and played out to backward point where there's a decent save
taken from off stump on a decent length and clipped into the off side
full length just outside off stump, played forward and gets it to point again
drives at this, a touch fuller, and plays with the angle past point to the sweeper
straight line on a decent length, this is how to do it Belly says Trott and flicks through square leg
bumper, Trott stays inside the line and plays it comfortably
back of a length just outside off stump, cut to backward point
full on the leg stump, clipped down to long leg and Kulasekara races to his right, slides and save, excellent work
length ball just outside off stump, Trott opens the face and guides it to third man, they push hard for two but Trott decides against it
back of a length just outside off stump, blocked into midwicket off the inner half of bat
back of a length just outside off stump, pulled and gets it to the deep square leg
length outside off and driven out to deep cover point
full ball on the stumps and Trott times it perfectly between midwicket and mid-on, don't bowl there to Trott, excellent timing
and again, this time it's a touch more middle and leg so Trott plays out to deep square leg, you won't earn a living bowling on Trott's pads
full and wide and left alone outside off stump
length ball just outside off, pushed forward into the covers

cut hard outside off and dropped at backward point by a diving Dilshan who threw through the air and got a solid two hands to the chance but couldn't hang on, in the end you would have to say he should have held that
length outside off stump, too close to cut and Trott gets beaten outside the off stump
just tries to dab this and does it successfully down to third man
length ball outside the left-hander's off stump this time, goes to cut but doesn't time it, gets it backward of point
back of a length outside off stump, cut hard into the ground and the deep cover point has to run to his right to field and they get two
straighter line and flicked through midwicket for another couple
poor stroke, a bit of a waft outside off to a length ball that wasn't at all there to drive, very un-Trott
back of a length outside off stump, punched into the covers standing tall
on the pads, not a clean connection but works it past mid-on and they pick up a comfortable two
pitched up outside off, gets half forward and drives, comes off the bottom of the bat towards mid-off
touch short, stays back and steers a single to third man
full and in the channel, punched on the front foot straight to short cover
line and length outside off, opens the face for one more to third man
short of a length and there's width for Trott to chop into the ground through point out to the sweeper
angled across, touch short and dabbed through square for another single
goes across and tickles one off a length wide of mid-on
on the pads, length delivery and whipped past mid-on and out towards deep midwicket, picks the gap well and they pick up three
in the channel, waits on it and deflects to third man
pitched up, tight line around off stump, defended into the ground and Eranga fields in his follow through
tossed up outside off, gets forward and pushes into the covers
drops a little short, Trott waits on it and carves through cover point for a single
over the wicket to Cook, spinning in and tapped back to the bowler
floated up outside off, Cook goes down on one knee and sweeps, slightly awkward execution and he's off balance but picks up a couple
pushed through on the stumps, sits back and clips on through square leg
full and dipping, straightening a foot outside off, tapped defensively square
angled across, slightly short of a length and chopped off the back foot towards point
around off stump, good length, fails to time the ball back towards mid-off
pushed through on a length outside off stump, cut into the ground, again picks out point
Cook walks across his stumps as Kulasekara comes in, works the ball through midwicket
length delivery in the corridor outside off, tapped back

a run-out chance but it needed a direct hit from Dilshan! It was a fullish delivery outside off, Trott chopped down on it and the ball skittered into the gully region, Cook sent his partner back and he was scrambling, diving, probably wouldn't have made it
Cook moving around his crease again, gets forward and across to hoick through midwicket
reverses the hands and gets outside the line of off, gets a bottom edge on the paddle past Sanga, I think, though leg byes are signalled
Herath is very excited by this lbw appeal but Cook had planted his front foot well outside off, swept across the line and misses but the umpire rightly wasn't interested
floated up and pinged through point to the sweeper
tossed up around off stump, played with the turn through square leg
gets forward and works a single out towards long-on
good bumper from Kulasekara, gets up deceptively quickly at Trott as he comes forward, hooks in front of his eyes and the ball loops off the shoulder of the bat through leg gully
on the stumps, turned through the leg side
gets forward and blocks to off

an ungainly bit of work, this, from Trott, again showing his intent by walking out at Kula, hurried into pulling and it comes off the splice towards mid-on, who hits at the non-striker's end but Trott had made his ground
walks across and flicks a length ball behind square on the leg side
on the stumps, closes the face and steers another single to fine leg
looped up outside off, leans forward and taps into the covers
gets forward, pushed back down the ground
worked off the pads into a gap at square leg, they think about a second but decide against
full and flighted on middle and leg, comes forward and punches to long-on
quicker delivery around the line of off, Cook gets down low to play a controlled sweep through square leg and bring up the 100 for England
goes across his stumps and taps a full ball towards midwicket
skidded through outside off, Cook hangs back and plays a delicate, forceful late cut past short third man for a boundary, first in nine overs
short and wide this time and muscled off the back foot in front of square
still pitching a touch short, cracked hard into the ground towards point where Jayawardene takes off superbly to prevent any damage
gets forward to a full ball, played back towards mid-off
pre-meditated lap stroke from Cook, inventive stuff, getting down low outside off and flicking the ball to fine leg
on the stumps, worked through midiwcket - and that's the captain's half-century
played back past the bowler for a single
full and punched to long-on coming forward
gets across his stumps and sweeps through square leg
the arm ball from Herath nearly inveigles its way through Trott's defence, gets an inside edge past his stumps
on the stumps, worked into the leg side for another single, these two rotating the strike well
flatter, around off stump, comes forward and knocks one to long-on again
cheeky from Trott, plays a fine reverse sweep, using the pace of Dilshan's skiddy offbreaks to pick up another boundary
pushed through on the stumps, glanced through square to the man in the deep
round the wicket, tossed up on off stump, gets forward to clip through mid-on
back over the wicket, length ball outside off, tapped through point
dabs one short into the leg side
off-stump line, pushed through, Trott waits and clips off his pads
tossed up around off stump, good flight and blocked back to the bowler
full and dipping around off stump, Trott drives but again sends it straight back to the bowler
flatter trajectory, goes across and clips the ball through square for one
over the wicket, tossed up, punched back past the bowler to long-on
tight line around off, leans forward and blocks towards point
a little quicker, on off stump, Trott chops the ball into the ground towards midwicket, who field - a better over from Herath, just two singles off it
full and around off from round the wicket, sweeps but picks out backward square

dropped, another chance spurned by Dilshan, of all people, this time off his own bowling, Cook advanced and chipped the ball back, wide of the bowler but he moved to his right, got to the flight ... and finger-tipped it away
gets forward and takes one in front of square on the off side
Trott punches back past the bowler and Dilshan, in trying to collect, sort of rugby tackles Cook in slow motion. He extricates himself from underneath and they get a run after all
driven, played back to the bowler
tossed up, gets forward and steers a single through the covers
on the stumps, played through square leg
length ball, stands up and plays the ball back to long-on, Herath this time bumps into Cook

attempts the sweep, playing across the line and hit on the front pad, Dar gives it - but Cook decides to review. Although you could see middle and leg stump this looked in line and Hawk Eye confirms as much, not much turn but it beat the pad and the impact was level with off stump, the decision stands and England's captain is gone, taking their review with him
gets forward, plays away from his front pad and squeezes out a single through backward square via an inside edge
Trott waits and plays his get-out shot down the ground to long-on again
angled in around leg stump, clipped off the back foot through square leg
tossed up and worked off the pads through square leg
length, on the stumps, played back on the leg side
drops a touch short, Root hops into position, puts his dukes up pulls in front of deep midwicket for a couple
gets forward to a length ball and punched back past the bowler to long-on
full and on the stumps, you know what Trott has done with it, don't you (clue: on long)
changes the angle, round the wicket, Root nudges into a gap off his pads and they get back for two
floated up and worked back, Herath gets across to field off his own bowling
touch short and wide of the off stump, hangs back and whips through midwicket to the sweeper
Root continues to be very active in the crease, drops back and gives himself room to cut through point
floated up very full, jams the bat down for a single through cover-point
pushes forward, gets an inside edge to backward square leg, they think about taking tow but Sangakkara scampers across to collect
floated up, waits and dabs short on the off side
slightly short, around middle and off, nudged to midwicket
hangs back in the crease and defends a length ball towards point
back of a length, plays cross-batted into the ground, short of cover and they steal a single
length delivery, walks into it outside off and nudges to midwicket
gets right across his stumps and clips through square leg, into a gap for a couple
tight line, length ball on off, gets forward and shows it a straight bat in defence
skips forward and picks a gap through the covers, wants two from the moment he sets off - and gets them
gets forward and dabs one into the off side
pushed through on off stump, Trott waits and punches one through mid-on off the back foot
tossed up, punched on the front foot to the cover sweeper
played back down the ground to long-on
wheels away outside off, Root dances forward and punches another single through cover
dug in short and Root pulls in the air, in front of deep midwicket, who moves to his left but fails to collect the ball cleanly first time - Mathews gives Perera a glare
sits back and dabs a length ball behind point for another single - Root lighting England up like a dynamo here
fullish, outside off, punched to a fielder in the covers
length ball, comes forward outside off and works a single to long-on - that's Trott's fifty up too
good line and length, Root opens his stance and steers a single to third man
full and straight and driven back to the bowler
a little short and Root goes back in the crease and pulls hard wide of deep backward square for a couple
back in the crease again, clipped through midwicket
Trott forward, reaches outside off to guide to short third man
full on the stumps, pushed down to long on
back and chopped a length ball to point
pushed back to the bowler from the stumps
length ball on off stump, Trott forward and pushes to point
length ball just outside off, Trott shaped to play it to leg but ended up clipped back to the bowler from a foot and a half outside off
width to work with, drives a length ball past point and they get two as the sweeper goes to his left
middle and leg half-volley and Trott clips over midwicket, really well timed, a poor delivery
length ball just outside off stump, played forward and dropped towards point, they turn down the single
length just outside off stump, guided down to third man
full toss on middle stump, tucked into midwicket and a parrying saves at least a second run
very full outside off but Root's drive goes straight to backward point, missed out there
down across the off stump and ramps it from a straight line over short long leg, super execution, very brave too
full and well wide outside off stump, Root has to lean right out to driven and gets it to deep cover, would have been wide if he would have left it
full ball on off stump, pushed to mid-on whose on the edge of the circle and they get a quick single
goes to ramp again but it was a better length and Root can only get it off the toe, having adjusted slightly to playing with a more straight bat, towards the keeper
length ball outside off stump, Trott opens the face and runs it down to third man
slower ball, 73mph, ends up a full toss on off stump, Root opens the face and guides wide of third man for a couple
a step to leg and pulled from just outside off, drags it on a couple of bounces to deep square leg
leg side wide
length ball around off stump, Trott pushes forward and plays it towards mid-on, they take on the fielder and get home very comfortably for the single
low full toss on off stump, slower again at 73mph, Root gets it off the toe to midwicket
another pull aimed into the leg side but it squirts off the toe of the bat through cover! Bizarre but runs away from the fielders at such a pace that they get a couple
full toss wide of off stump, Trott leans out to it and guides it down to third man
another wide full ball, Root reaches out and gets a bottom edge towards point and they get a quick single
full ball just outside off stump, Root drives and opens the face to get it past extra cover, it's timed so well and beats Jayawardene's dive at deep cover, what timing from Trott
in the slot again but this time finds the bowler, it was a touch fuller
full and wide of off stump, too wide, just on the guideline though but they are, by definition, only a guide
full and wide of off again, this time driven out to deep cover
very full on off stump, driven out to deep cover opening the face, quite wristily played
slower ball at 67mph, wide of off stump, Root swings wildly at it and it comes off a huge outside edge but loops out of the reach of point, Dilshan got to it but couldn't hold on with a dive
length outside off, guided down to third man
length ball again around off stump, guided again behind square on the off side
another slower ball, 73mph, Root stays leg side of it and guides down once again to third man
length ball, slapped with a bounce to mid-on
length on off stump, opens the face and guides to third man
taken from a length on the stumps and short-arm jabbed over midwicket, superbly timed, brilliant stroke
full just outside off and again the timing is perfect, gets this only to deep cover
slower ball outside off stump, 65mph, Root tries to cut and misses
oh dear, a full toss outside off, slower again at 60mph, Root saw it early and whacked it over midwicket
down the track and carves out to deep cover, they charge back for a second, top running, England upping the tempo
driven out to the same fielder, a little closer to the deep cover this time though and just the single
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
down the track, gets outside it and runs it down to long off
leg stump, flicked to deep backward square leg
off stump, driven past extra cover that enables them to take two as long off comes to his left
full on the stumps, Root swings it out to deep midwicket with a sweep, goes to 50 in 43 balls, good effort

full on the stumps, Trott sweeps and misses and is given out lbw straight away by Billy Bowden, it was too full to sweep really and looked pretty straight. Only things against the call would have been if it was sliding down but I doubt it, caught almost full on the boot
length ball on off stump, blocked back up the wicket
a touch fuller, flicked down to long on
full just outside off, Morgan is back and slashing down to third man
full on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
full on the stumps again, Root goes for the reverse paddle and connects well to fine third man, brilliantly picked up
full toss on the stumps, a leading edge loops over the bowler's head and they take a quick single before extra cover can get in

slower ball, slugged into the leg side, straight up, Sangakkara, drops it!Sri Lanka hold a catch with Jayawardene clinging on to a simple chance at deep midwicket, bit of a top edge from Root but a fine innings played really well

full on the off stump, played forward, a huge cry for lbw and given out! It was pad first but going across Morgan and was it going on to miss off stump? Bowden thought not. Very full and Morgan couldn't get the bat down on it in time
slower ball yorker on off stump and Bopara for a moment was deceived but he got the bat down in time
length ball, pushed to point on the front foot
back of a length just outside off, hammered with a pull back to the bowler who parries and saves any runs

driven at outside off stump, thin edge and taken by Sangakkara a good low catch going down to his left, Buttler walked and a second ball duck is a second failure in this competition. It wasn't right there to drive and Buttler got a little tickle on it trying to force into the covers
pushed at hard and gets it down to third man for a single, no, there's a buzzard, with a poor stroke
full on the stumps driven firmly to mid-off who's in the circle
slower ball on the stumps, dropped into the covers for a single
another decent slower ball just outside off, pushed at and Bopara plays and misses
length ball on the stumps, pushed into midwicket
firm push down to long on from a length ball on the stumps
a swing down the ground, doesn't get all of it and long on comes in to field
cramps Bresnan up as he tries to stay leg side and pushes back to the bowler

full and straight and cleans Bresnan up as it tries to swing it down the ground and loses his leg stump, just missed a straight one there Bressy. It seemed to be in the slot to drive, Bresnan tried but made no connection
off stump on a length, punched through the covers

slower ball on the stumps, Broad deceived but then dropped the bat on it on off stump, runs it to point who they take a single to and they throw is absolutely awful, nowhere near the stumps, lucky the had a man backing up
fast, straight yorker, dug out through midwicket
length ball on off stump, pushed back past the bowler
full ball, driven wide of long on they run hard and get back for the second with a dive from Broad, well ran, easily home in the end
played forward to a ball on off stump, pushed to point and they get an easy single
full ball on the stumps, Broad steps to leg and gets it up and over mid-off, a fine stroke and well timed
full ball on off stump and mowed into the crowd over long-on, big stroke, the timing was superb, that's gone way back, 88 metres
slower ball outside off and slogged past midwicket, four more, well struck again
oh yes, over extra cover for six, what a shot, wide of off stump and smashed into the crowd again, fabulous strike, what a shot, best of the lot today
full ball on the stumps and smashed over the bowler's head, Bowden dives out of the way and ends up on the floor signalling four, another sweet strike from Bopara
fine yorker, dug out down the ground but it's gone slowly towards long-off so they get two
full toss on the stumps and smashed into the stand again! What late hitting from Bopara, taken off a straight line and over long on it goes

inn2.comm: angled across on a good length, quite wide and Perera has a look, leaves it alone
tighter to the off stump, maybe a fraction short of a length, defended down on to the track
length ball around the top of off, goes across and defends, head bowed again
full and drifting down the leg side, clipped straightforwardly off his pads to fine leg
length ball on leg stump, no swing for Anderson and Dilshan helps this round the corner for the first boundary of the innings
straight line, shaping back over the top of middle, blocked short on the leg side
starts with a good line, back of a length and on the stumps, Perera shows it doughty defence
similar line and length, shuffles across his stumps and blocks back to the bowler again
full and fired across the bows, Perera crouches and tries to shovel to leg, the ball rolls to mid-on
back of a length and pulled fiercely from outside off, high like a kite over square leg, one-bounce four
pitched up and pushed back to mid-off, Dilshan had wandered out of his ground and Anderson has a shy but there's no one backing up and they get an overthrow
short of a good length and in the channel outside off, Dilshan shoulders arms extravagantly
angled across on a good length and pushed back

goes big *shuts eyes* - oh, he's been caught at mid-on! Perera tried to execute the pick-up off a length over long-on, looked like he'd nailed it but the ball actually came off the toe of the bat and looped rather forlornly to Bopara, who crouched under it for a safe take and England's first wicket
gets forward and pushes past cover into a gap for a couple
good-length delivery outside off, Sanga blocks watchfully
that's a beauty from Anderson, shaping in over middle and off, beating the inside edge and England all go up - but Bowden isn't interested and quite right too, as it only flicked the thigh pad
goes across to a length ball on the stumps, squared up slightly and an edge flies behind point for one
slightly back of a length and fired across
slightlly full, on middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler with a straight bat
on the body, short and dabbed through square leg for a single
strays down the leg side, short delivery and Dilshan only needs get a glove on it to help the ball away to boundary
gets forward and pushes back to the bowler
touch short and leg side again, nudged off the hips to fine leg for a single
fullish and  in the channel outside off, Dilshan tries to Happy Gilmore the ball through the off side but it's not a clean connection and picks out mid-off
ducking in, pitched up around middle and leg, pushed back towards mid-on
full and angling back in on middle and leg, tries to flick square and comes off the pad
gets forward to defends a length delivery around off
lovely shot from Sangakkara, rocks back and effortlessly pings a short ball through backward square for four
length delivery, on leg stump, attempts to glance and the ball deflects behind square off the pad
short of a good length, over the top of middle, blocked from the crease
pitched up, sliding on to the pads, clipped wide of fine leg for a couple
jaffa from Broad, fired across, Sanga stays back and pushes just inside the line as the balls sears through past the edge
beaten again, this time on the inside, short of a length again and nibbles back a touch as the bat comes down and through to Buttler
length ball on leg stump, flicked wristily behind square for a single
slightly short and outside off stump, Dilshan gets on top of the ball and plays it into the ground in front of point
good length, on the stumps, blocked back down the track
full and straight and driven, looked good off the bat but mid-off comfortably cuts it off before having a shy
pitched up and tapped into the covers
drops a little short, in the channel, glides one down to third man
lovely delivery, slanted across and seaming just a touch, Sanga fiddles injudiciously and misses
good length, pushed across and prodded into the off side
Broad has got his dematerialiser working today, somehow ghosting another delivery through the batsman, Dilshan beaten and the ball sailing over the top of the stumps
fuller, on the stumps and played back
on the stumps, slightly short and worked through backward square
Sangakkara spots this coming, half-tracker dug in and he backs away, flays the ball aerially over cover, superb power and placement on the cut shot
length ball this time, a touch too straight and Sanga just gets a tickle on it, flicking the ball fine for consecutive boundaries
pushed across on a length, defended outside off short of point
slightly full of a length and coming back with the arm towards middle and off, pushed back to mid-on
tight lines, gets forward to defend on off stump
slightly wider, good length in the channel, trying to tempt Dilshan, he lets it go
length delivery on the stumps, clipped through midwicket to the fielder on the fence
shuffles across, brings the bat down and tucks a length ball off the pads in front of backward square
length ball, curving gently back and cramping the drive, fielded on the bounce in the covers
back of a length and wide of the stumps, Sanga guides rather than cuts the ball through point but it races away for four
tighter to the off stump, gets forward to block a length ball
pitched up in the channel, more good placement from Sanga, threading a punched front-foot drive through the covers, won't quite make the rope
coming back in, short of a length and Dilshan is hit on the thigh pad trying to work to leg
oof, looks like he's taken this in the baby-maker ... another nip-backer, rising off a length and Dilshan winces on impact
in the channel, good length, blocked into the off side - better from Bresnan, after a poor couple of deliveries to begin with
round the wicket, tossed up and pushed back to the bowler
full and flighted, leans forward and taps into the covers, thinks about one but it sent back
tossed up, drifting towards middle stump, swept precisely off the front pad behind square and they pick up three - brings up the Sri Lanka fifty too
over the wicket, floated up, pretty much a full toss, driven back and Root gets a finger on it, deflecting to long-on
on the stumps, worked wide of mid-on for another single
pushed through on middle stump, tucked to leg
Bresnan bangs it in short, angled down the leg side, Dilshan watches it over his head, could have been called on width too but Dar is uninterested
glanced off the legs into a gap and they get back for a couple
straight line, works a length ball to fine leg for another single
pushed across on a good length outside off, dabbed towards point off the back foot
bit more width, leaving the batsman as he swishes loosely, doesn't get anything on it as it zings through to the keeper
another short ball from Bresnan, this one climbing in the corridor as Sanga tries to uppercut and misses again
pushed through outside off, skips forward and punches a single through the covers
round the wicket, full and outside off, driven to Bell standing at short extra cover
drifting towards leg stump, worked through square leg with a turn of the wrists
full and straight, tries to whip to leg and picks out midwicket
flat trajectory outside off stump, goes back and cuts deftly through backward point, good running brings two
very full and straight, sweeps and misses, hit on the pad but the ball was heading past leg, short fine leg swoops on the ball to prevent a run
slightly back of a length, over middle and leg, dabbed short of backward square for one
in the channel outside off, waits on it and plays with soft hand towards point, they pick up another
on the legs, slightly short and nudged in front of deep midwicket
angled across outside off, stays back and guides a single to third man
well-directed short ball, and well played too, Dilshan rocking back and pulling flat down to fine leg
length delivery in the corridor outside off, steered straight to point for a dot to Bresnan
innocuous from Root here, full and down the leg side, swept firmly and Morgan then dives over the ball at deep backward square to give Sri Lanka their first boundary in five overs
there's the first six of the innings, this one a genuine crump from Dilshan, skipping out and lofting the ball straight down the ground
turned with the spin through square leg
four more, though it's not far from a chance to mid-off! Root dropped short, Sanga stood up and punched uppishly down the ground, beats the fielder and runs away
worked through midwicket for a single
tossed up and swept, again in the air, floating through backward square off a top edge but safe
angled in and turned through backward square, they put pressure on the fielder and, although Bowden checks for the run out with the third umpire, make a second
on the pads again and flicked through square for a single
stays in the crease, taps a length ball towards cover
another bouncer, at the top of Sanga's block, he ducks ... and this time Aleem Dar calls it on height
straight line, defended from the crease in front of middle and leg
short of a length and jabbed off the hips through midwicket for a single
back of a length, seaming back and taking the inside edge on to pad, deflects for a single into the gully
tossed up outside off, little bit of grip and spin back in, blocked short of the man at cover and they pick up one
length ball straightening on middle and leg, prodded short and square, Buttler hares after it
taps a length ball on off into the covers
goes back and across, works against the turn through backward square
flighted, going on with the arm outside off, Dilshan sits back and plays with soft hands but straight to short third man
full and drifting, dipping on off stump, Dilshan gets to the pitch and punches wristily to long-on for a single
full on the stumps, Dilshan forward pressing back to the bowler
hint of width outside off stump, flicked down to third man
full on the off stump, pressed to extra cover
full again but tighter to off stump, pressed inside mid-off so they get a quick single
a firm drive from just outside off stump, mid-off scrambles to his right and saves well
good length on off stump, blocked into the covers and Bell comes in to save the single
off stump, punched out through the covers and they get a single to the sweeper
just outside off on a length, forced away off the back foot through point and the sweeper comes in quickly so just one
forward on middle and off, played back to the bowler
bit of turn away from Sangakkara's off side push and gets beaten
tighter line and it skids on a little, pushed into the covers
forward and carefully pressed to point
length ball, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
full on the stumps, flicked to midwicket
flicked off middle and leg out to the midwicket sweeper
punched from a full length on off stump to extra cover
firm drive to mid-off and they take on Root who fumbles, good batting
flicked from off stump to midwicket
floated up on off stump and pushed down to long off, 100 up
flicked from just outside off to midwicket
floated up on off stump, clipped down to long on
shuffles around in the crease to create space for the back foot punch through the covers

skip down the wicket and finds long on that is pretty silly you have to say, a thick inside edge, nowhere near enough contact on the stroke and Dilshan is gone. Three cheap overs from England, Dilshan has got frustrated, tried to take Swann into the stands and perished
tries to flick into the leg side and gets struck outside the line of off stump
full ball on the stumps, punched down to long on, 50 for Sangakkara, been a very nice innings, form continues from Cardiff
covers up just outside the off stump
back to late cut just outside off stump, finds backward point
back of a length, clipped to square leg
full ball on off stump, clipped to Root at midwicket
carefully blocked just outside off stump
off stump, forward and pushed to extra cover
a touch more flight and a little wider, pushed down to long off
pushed into the off side from just outside off from a full length
a little straighter, flicked around the corner, just wide of the 45
taken from outside off and lifted over mid-off for four, nicely timed, just carefully struck over the top with the man up
goes back now and pulled out towards deep midwicket, there's a fumble but it doesn't cost a second
leg side wide
off stump, carefully pushed to mid-off and they set off for a sharp single
angled in towards off stump, blocked back to the bowler
a touch fuller, driven to the right of extra cover but mid-off is quickly to his left to slide and save the second
takes on mid-off again for a cheeky single
full and opens the face to steer it out to deep cover
full on the stumps pushed down to long on
off stump, pushed forward through cover
off stump, played to midwicket
this is just a little shorter and flicked behind square on the leg side
forward and blocked into the covers
very full, dug out back to the bowler
pushed out through the covers to the sweeper
length ball and punched to mid-off
poor ball, leg stump and flicked wide of short long leg, nicely tucked away
fuller outside off, driven firmly to mid-off where Cook dives and saves to his right
leg stump again, tucked through square leg
just outside off, played with a half-forward press into the covers
off stump and full, pressed to extra cover
reverse swept from just outside off to short third man
just outside off, flicked to midwicket
lifted over midwicket this time, gets it out to the sweeper
off stump, driven off the inner half of the bat back to the bowler
off stump, dropped in front of point but the fielder is up quickly to save the single
a touch short and pulled behind square on the leg side, deep backward square runs to his left
and slides past the outside edge first ball back, it was on a good length and Mahela nibbled at it outside off stump
down the wicket and smashed over long on, what a shot! Steps down the wicket and takes a middle stump ball on a good length over long on, great strike
now times a belter off the front foot past point to the sweeper, that was powered away too, good signs
leg side wide
length ball on the stumps, tucked down to long leg
blocked just outside off stump to point
full just outside off stump, flicked firmly to mid on
floated up on the off stump, ran back to the bowler
straight line, ran around the corner to the 45
stays leg side off a ball just outside off and presses through cover
down the wicket and flicked in the air out to deep midwicket, very safe stroke
press forward just outside off stump into the covers
stays back, it slides on and Sangakkara plays to short third man
length ball and flicked off the stumps inbetween long leg and deep square, nicely played
just outside off stump, guided down to third man
short ball, Sanga goes for the flick over the slips and misses
step to leg and hammered in front of point to the sweeper
four more, pulled to the same area as the first ball of the over, finding his touch Mahela
full ball, firm push down to long on
played from just outside off stump, flicked to midwicket
flatter ball and I thought it was too close to sweep but Jayawardene gets the reverse paddle sweep away past short third man, good work from Bairstow charging round at deep cover
middle stump line, played to extra cover with a forward push
forward, an inside edge runs past midwicket from middle and off
flicked to midwicket with the spin from just outside off
swept from off stump, excellent sliding save from backward square, saved three runs
length ball, picked up behind square on the leg side, tucked away really well and finds the rope again, boundaries coming for Jayawardene
full toss outside off, firmly punched into the covers and Root gets down to slide and save four again, cracking work
length outside off, dabbed down to third man
slapped hard from just outside off to extra cover
driven hard out to deep cover and they run well and get back for the second
full ball just outside off stump, slapped down the ground and again there's a great save in the outfield, Broad this time gets down to prevent four
stays back and dabs to short third man, they take a quick run
back in the crease and punching out to deep cover
tossed up outside off stump, punched down to long on
pressed down to long off from a full length
floated up on middle stump and pushed past midwicket
off stump and again a push just beats the fielder and they get a single out into the deep, this time to long off
length wide of off stump, flashed at and gets a bit outside edge a long way wide of the keeper, it would have carried nicely to a slip!
more width outside off stump, slapped out to deep cover
tight off stump line, dropped through midwicket where the slip had come from, such is cricket
pushed from off stump to extra cover
off stump and full, it was well driven, nicely timed that, Bopara dives and saves with a dive to his right
blocked through square leg from a good length on middle and off
Buttler up to the stumps, length outside off, Jayawardene sits back and slides a single down to third man
round the wicket, full and shaping a little away from Sanga, who leans out and pings a couple through the covers
full and outside off, driven wide of mid-off, who scrambles across to cut it off
back over the wicket, pitched full of a length in the channel, driven to the cover sweeper
waits on a length ball outside off stump, steers on down to third man, they think about two but won't get it
another dab off the back foot to third man from Mahela
back of a length, this spits off the surface and is defended back down, Mahela opening his eyes a little wider

skips across to hooks but only manages to pick out deep square leg! England have the breakthrough they desperately needed, Anderson the bowler, as so often it is! The ball was short and outside the line of off, Jayawardene moved to his right but couldn't keep the shot down, Bairstow plunging forward to take a good catch
slightly short of a length, angled across and Sanga gets a thick outside edge, not far away from Cook in the gully and down to third man
dug in short, over leg stump, ducks underneath it
slightly short of a good length again, defends in front of off stump
another bouncer, Kula Shaker crouches again - this one is called on height
hops back and across and defends a length ball outside off - well the pinch-hitter isn't doing much hitting yet
pitched up, tapped into the covers and they risk one - direct hit would have done for Sanga at the non-striker's end
pulled emphatically through midwicket, that's what Kula's in for! Not all that short but picked up superbly and cracked in front of the fielder in the deep
backs away, Bresnan tries to follow him with a short, wide ball
short again, Kulasekara pulls and this comes high off the bat, dropping just short of mid-on
angled across and steers one through point off the back foot
another bumper, pulled into the ground through backward square
angled across on a fullish length, taps in front of point and they jog one
slightly wide outside off, cuts behind backward point and Bresnan gallumphs round from third man to prevent a boundary
short, pushes one in front of point
in the channel, line and length, Kula nearly swings himself off his feet, misses
takes the pace off, dug in short, shovelled round the corner off the back foot
gets forward and pushes a full-length ball into a gap in the covers
excellent delivery from Anderson, nearly does for Kula - right up in the blockhole, dipping towards leg stump, gets an inside edge on it and Buttler pulls of a terrific stop diving to his left
low full toss outside the line of off, pushed wide of cover, long-off keeps them to one
rolls the fingers over it, slow legcutter, hits Kulasekara on the thigh pad, Bresnan appeals and point swoops to give England a precious dot
bouncer again, hangs back and flails unsuccessfully at it

short of a good length, Kulasekara hoicks it high into the leg side, doesn't come off the middle but it's short of Bairstow running in off the fence, he does well to stop it on the bounce with his shoulder, maybe even taking it on the head
steps away as Bresnan goes full and wide, outside the tramlines though
on a length, swings like a kid in the playground, the ball squirts to leg for a single
angled across on a length, gets forward and drives on the up to long-off - that's the ton up for Sanga, a superb knock, his 15th in ODIs
wide and cut away in front of cover, they want two but Kula and Sanga collide, Kula drops his bat but the throw to the keeper is high! Run-out chance missed by England
advances and throws the hands, driving a length ball to mid-off, they run anyway
stays back and angles a single to third man
good bumper, Kulasekara swings across the line and misses
goes full and straight, the batsman clears the front leg and hammers one down to long-on
slower ball and Sangakkara picks it, sends it over deep midwicket! Perfectly timed, in every sense, a brutal haymaker that bounces just short of the fence - Sri Lanka need 76 from the last ten overs
length ball outside off and thumped through the covers, stand and deliver from Kulasekara, who gets it right out of the meat for another vital boundary
gets forward and swings hard, inside-edging through square leg
length ball, walks out and drags a pull shot into the leg side
another bumper, wide of the off stump, Kula flinches and looks at the umpire - but it's okay
short of a length, on the leg stump and heaved over square, the ball flies away for four more!
pitched up in the blockhole, gets his bat down in time and squeezes it to fine leg
length ball on the stumps, hit in the air through mid-on for a single to the man on the rope
angled across on a length, Sanga chops a cut shot into the ground through extra cover
pitched up on leg stump, Kula lumps it back down the ground, aerial again but it drops well short of long-on
full and wide, Sanga is stuck on his heels and plays no stroke - inside the tramlines too
slower ball, on the stumps, inside-edged through backward square leg
swings across the line at a short ball and deflects it past the diving Buttler for four to long leg - that's the fifty partnership from just 40 balls
tossed up and driven through the covers, the sweeper has to run to his left
round the wicket, driven on the front foot through the covers, just a single this time
over the wicket, rocks back and fetches a length ball into the crowd at deep midwicket, immaculate striking from Kulasekara, who's doing more than pinching runs now!
tossed up slightly fuller and smoked into the crowd over the same part of the ground, Kula down on one knee this time - what a couple of blows!
takes the pace off, bit more air, Kula knows his work is done and pushes back down the ground
tossed up on middle and off, defended - Sanga's happy to give up a dot now
six more for Kulasekara, happy slapping Broad high over fine leg, the ball was short, may have come off a top edge but it soars into the stands!
overpitched and thrashed straight back down the ground like a hockey puck, Broad sticks out a boot but can't stop it skimming over the surface for four to long-off
full-length ball outside off stump, Kula gets a big stride in, opens the shoulders and clouts the ball over extra cover, it beats the sweeper running round - four more, and the half-century!
comes forward and steers a shortish ball into the covers
waits on a short ball and blocks towards point, Sanga sends Kula back
pushed across, Sanga punches one through the off side
takes an early step across the stumps, drives wide of mid-on, picks a gap and this races away
dabs a shortish ball towards point, Sanga again sends the exuberant Kulasekara back
walks forward, cuts into the ground, towards point, they take one
leg-side ball, on a length, flicks the pad and runs through to Buttler
very full and straight, gets the yorker in but Kula digs in out
pitched up on middle and leg, swings hard across the line and clubs one through square
on length, stands talls and chips the ball over mid-on
pitched up on the stumps, squeezes the ball away through square leg
angled across and Sanga takes a no-risk single through the covers
slower bouncer, heading down the leg side, Kula ducks it and wide is signalled
offcutter from Anderson, feet still and swings hard, edged behind but Buttler can only get glove tips on it
picks a gap out towards deep extra cover and they get back for a second
full and on off stump, crunched straight back down the ground to long-on - imperious batting from Sanga
pitched up on the stumps, chipped down the ground for a single to long-on
angled across, stays in the crease and steers towards point
length ball, pushed across from wide on the crease, Sanga made an early move outside off but can only knock it back to the bowler
full and wide and played out in front of deep extra cover via a flowing flash of the blade
touch short, sits in the crease and swivel-pulls flat through square leg, it's cut off before the boundary... the champagne remains on ice
tip and run into the covers - the scores are tied and Sangakkara will remain on strike to complete the job
short and on the hips, pulled lazily, sweetly through square leg for four and Sri Lanka win by seven wickets
